issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2, controller requirements) incorrectly refers to the callback parameter type as Consumer<List<Note>> when describing the PersonController methods. This conflicts with the template and solution code, where the PersonController methods use Consumer<List<Person>>. The mismatch (Note vs Person) is likely an accidental copy/paste error and can confuse students about the expected generic type for the controller callbacks and the mapping between the textual requirements and the code skeleton.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> (not Consumer<List<Note>>) when describing the PersonController callback parameter. This will align the textual requirements with the template and solution code and remove potential confusion.
